title: Stade Roland Garros
summary: Stade Roland Garros (French pronunciation: ​[stad ʁɔlɑ̃ ɡaʁos]; "Roland Garros Stadium")  is a complex of tennis courts located in Paris that hosts the French Open, a tournament also known as Roland Garros. It is a Grand Slam championship tournament played annually around the end of May and the beginning of June. The complex is named after Roland Garros, a pioneering French aviator, and it was constructed in 1928 to host France's first defence of the Davis Cup.
